page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
This land is east of the ancient village of Abinger in the Green Belt. It is mostly wooded greensand hills, which drain quickly but draw the mist - there are few roads, but a vast network of footpaths and bridlepaths, beloved of ramblers. There are three working farms, three riding-stables, with scattered houses and a few small hamlets. Many of the inhabitants are commuters.
Southward the land rises to Leith Hill Tower (out of the area). A ridge runs southeast to the Plough Inn at Coldharbour, with the springs of the Pippbrook to the east and the Tillingbourne to the west. These last have been dammed to form the lake at }
